oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Ronnie McDowell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Ronnie McDowell (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Recording is from an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Ronnie McDowell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Ronnie McDowell introduction voiceover] -- (00:34) Emery invites McDowell to discuss his album Love to Burn and the track "Dangerous" -- (02:01) Emery and McDowell reflect on a 1920's flat-bed truck for The Good Ole Days restaurant that McDowell is in the process of opening -- (04:23) McDowell reflects on Exile while introducing Alabama's rendition "Take Me Down" -- (06:12) Emery invites McDowell to speak on why he continues to take inspiration from his time as a barber in the Navy -- (06:45) Emery mentions that Johnny Lee is planning on moving to Nashville -- (07:09) Emery encourages McDowell to discuss what his new single will be and the longevity of a record -- (09:06) Emery and McDowell discuss the recording process of Jim Reeves and Patsy Cline for "I Fall to Pieces" -- (11:08) McDowell and Emery discuss cases of identity theft of country stars -- (14:13) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Ronnie McDowell outro voiceover] -- (15:26) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Ronnie McDowell introduction voiceover] -- (15:43) Emery discusses Mickey Gilley's "My Affection" -- (16:04) Emery invites McDowell to reflect on a strange incident while working on the road and McDowell's ideas for possible band names -- (20:00) Emery inquires about McDowell's ability to 'reggae' -- (20:44) Emery questions McDowell about his family life, and McDowell being in a band -- (22:27) Emery inquires about McDowell's attractive image -- (25:08) Emery and McDowell discuss McDowell's 'road album' and production company: Strawberry Records -- (26:59) Emery encourages McDowell to reflect on the availability of "The King is Gone" and Floyd Porter -- (29:04) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Ronnie McDowell outro voiceover]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; McDowell, Ronnie;
